repnme.cdata!:
Ecuador - Environmental Management
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Environmental Management Technical
            Assistance Project's outcome is rated as satisfactory,
            sustainability as likely, institutional development impact
            as substantial, Bank performance as unsatisfactory, and
            Borrower performance as satisfactory. The project was
            implemented during one of the worst economic crises the
            country has experienced, with the country's public
            policy priorities directed toward controlling the fiscal
            deficit. Government counterpart funding was often not
            forthcoming due to fiscal difficulties, creating delays in
            project implementation and threatening disbursements due to
            ineligibility of expenses on several occasions when loan
            proceeds were used in lieu of counterpart funding to finance
            project activities and taxes. The project has also suffered
            delays resulting from Ecuador's unstable political
            climate. The lessons learned from this project include:
            Complexity of the project has to be commensurate with the
            capacity of the Borrower. Technical assistance projects
            require adequate close supervision. Project sustainability
            and institutional strengthening require a close
            collaboration between the implementing agency and the
            Project Coordination Unit. Bank extension of closing date
            proved essential in achievement of project objectives.

repnme.cdata!:
Ecuador - Environmental Management
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Environmental
            Management Technical Assistance Project are twofold: (i) to
            provide support for the ongoing process of implementing a
            national environmental strategy; and (ii) to assist the
            Government in building up an environmental management
            capacity in urban areas, the Gulf of Guayaquil, and the
            Amazon. The project consists of the following components:
            (a) policy formulation and institutional strengthening; (b)
            environmental planning and management in the Ecuadorian
            Amazon; (c) municipal environmental management; and (d)
            environmental information and management in the Gulf of Guayaquil.
